Encrypt phone
Require a numeric PIN or password to decrypt your phone each time you turn it on

"You can encrypt your accounts, settings, downloaded apps and their data, media, and other files. Once you encrypt your phone, you must enter a numeric PIN or password to decrypt it each time you power it on: you can't unencrypt your phone except by performing a factory data reset, erasing all your data.
Encryption takes an hour or more. You must start with a charged battery and keep your phone plugged in until encryption is complete. If you interrupt the encryption process, you will lose some or all of your data."
Encrypt phone
No Lock screen PIN or password
You must set a Lock screen PIN or password before you can start encryption.
Confirm encryption
Encrypt phone? This operation is irreversible and if you interrupt it, you will lose data. Encryption takes an hour or more, during which the phone will restart several times.
Wait while your phone is being encrypted. ^1% complete.

"Encryption was interrupted and can't complete. As a result, the data on your phone is no longer accessible.
To resume using your phone, you must perform a factory reset. When you set up your phone after the reset, you'll have an opportunity to restore any data that was backed up to your Google Account."

Android Beam
Allow sharing of images or music by holding devices together

"When Direct/Android Beam is turned on, you can beam app content or files to other mobile devices by holding them close together.
1. NFC and Wi-Fi Direct devices are needed. 2. Turn on Direct/Android Beam on each device. 3. Select the screen or files to share (e.g. images from the Gallery). 4. Hold devices together (e.g. back to back). 5. Tap the screen that you want to send after shrinking the screen. (Each app determines what is sent or received.)
* Data that can be shared: browser pages, contacts, YouTube videos, images from the Gallery, music from the Music app, documents from Polaris Office."

"When Android Beam is turned on, you can beam app content or files to other mobile devices by holding them close together.
1. NFC and Bluetooth devices are needed. 2. Turn on Android Beam on each device. 3. Select the screen or files to share (e.g. images from the Gallery). 4. Hold devices together (e.g. back to back). 5. Tap the screen that you want to send after shrinking the screen. (Each app determines what is sent or received.)
* Data that can be shared: browser pages, contacts, YouTube videos, images from the Gallery, music from the Music app, documents from Polaris Office."

You must draw your unlock pattern to confirm that you want to erase the USB storage.
Use tethering to share your phone’s mobile data connection with a single computer over a USB cable.
To use your phone’s tethering capability, you must have the Smartphone Mobile HotSpot service added to your rate plan.

To tether your phone connect your phone to a computer with a USB cable and on your phone tap to select \"USB tethering\" located under \"Settings >> More… >> USB tethering & Mobile HotSpot\". Tethering works with Windows®7, Windows Vista®, and Linux. For more information on tethering with operating systems, go to www.android.com/tether .
For Windows XP, you may have to install a USB driver on your computer before you can tether your phone. To install the drivers enter the following URL on your computer’s browser.

When you connect your phone to a computer with a USB cable, you can either share your mobile data connection by tethering OR you can share files—you cannot do both. Do not turn on tethering if you want to use your computer to access your phone’s memory card.
Download Windows XP Driver
Please install SIM card in order to share your phone’s data connection with other devices using Mobile Wi-Fi HotSpot or USB tethering for internet access.

"When this feature is turned on, you can zoom in and out by triple-tapping the screen.
While zoomed in, you can: "
Pan: Drag two or more fingers across the screen." "
Adjust zoom level: Pinch two or more fingers together or spread them apart."
You can also temporarily magnify what's under your finger by triple-tapping and holding. In this magnified state, you can drag your finger to explore different parts of the screen. Lift your finger to return to your previous state.
Note: Triple-tap for magnification works everywhere except the keyboard and navigation bar."
Don’t Allow
%1$s can collect all of the text you type, except passwords. This includes personal data such as credit card numbers. It can also collect data about your interactions with the phone.

Restrict background data

"This feature may cause an app that depends on background data to stop working when Wi-Fi isn't available.
You can find more appropriate data usage controls in the settings available within the app."

"Any changes you make to your accounts on the web will be automatically copied to your phone.
Some accounts may also automatically copy any changes you make on the phone to the web. A Google Account works this way.
To choose which kinds of information to sync within each account, go to Settings > Accounts."

"Your mobile data connection will be disabled when the specified limit is reached.
Since data usage is measured by your phone, and your carrier may account for usage differently, consider using a conservative limit."

Quickly double-tap centre screen to turn it on. Screen will be turned off when you double-tap status bar or empty area on LG Home screen and Lock screen. KnockON works better when phone position stands still. Calibrate the motion sensor to improve accuracy.
"Double-tap phone quickly to turn screen on "
Put your palm on display for a second to hide upper part of the screen. Put it again to clear.
During an incoming call, pick up the phone from the flat surface to fade out the ringtone
During an incoming call, bring the phone to your ear to answer the call
During a call, put the phone on the flat surface to turn on speakerphone and pick up the phone and bring it to ear to turn it off
During the incoming call, pick up the phone from the flat surface to fade out the ringtone.
During the incoming call, bring the phone to ear to accept the incoming call.
During a call, put the phone on the flat surface to turn on speakerphone and pick up the phone and bring it to ear to turn it off.

Tap arrow to move the PIN input keypad to the left or right side of the display in order to use it easily with one hand.
Tap LEFT arrow or RIGHT arrow to adjust the position of button of call screen
Tap arrow to move the button of call screen to the left or right side of the display in order to use it easily with one hand.

Ask USB connection mode when connecting to a computer
You can synchronise your phone with Windows media player to facilitate the transfer and management of media files.
- MTP works with Windows Vista and Windows 7
- MTP also works with Windows XP if Windows media player 10 or latest versions are installed
- On Mac or other OSs, you can transfer files between computer and your phone by installing MTP software to your computer
"You can tether your phone to your computer with a USB cable, to share your phone's Internet connection with your computer."
- Tethering works with Windows Vista, Windows 7 and Linux
"- You can't mount your phone's SD card on your computer when USB is tethered"
- For more information, including using USB tethering with other OSs see http://www.android.com/tether#usb
You can use helpful LG software installed in your computer by connecting via USB.

You can connect your phone as camera to facilitate the transfer and management of photos or videos (When MTP is not supported, you can transfer files between computer and your phone with PTP connection).
- PTP works with Windows Vista, Windows 7 and Mac
- On Linux or other OSs, you can use PTP connection by installing PTP software to your computer
Transfer files in Windows; for Macs, use Android file transfer (see www.android.com/filetransfer)
Connect to LG mobile computer software
Transfer photos by connecting as a camera (transfer files when MTP is not supported)
Ask USB connection type when connection to PC
Share mobile network of the phone with computers
Mass storage mode enables you to transfer files between a storage in your phone and your computer when you connect your device to your computer via USB.
You can use your phone as a modem for a dial-up network.
You can charge your phone via USB without any data interaction.
USB storage mode enables you to transfer files between a storage in your phone and your computer when you connect your device to your computer via USB

"You can encrypt your system data(accounts, settings, downloaded applications and other files) stored in the internal storage by pressing the corresponding \"Encrypt device\" button below. Once you encrypt your phone, you will be required to enter a numeric PIN or password to decrypt it each time you power it on: you cannot un-encrypt your device except by performing a factory reset, erasing all your data.
Encryption takes an hour or more. You must start with a charged battery and keep your device plugged in until encryption is completed. If you interrupt the process, you will lose some or all of your data."

"You can encrypt your user data(downloaded applications, media and other files) stored in the internal storage or the SD card by pressing the corresponding \"Enable encryption\" button below. After you have enabled encryption, you may choose to disable it by pressing \"Disable encryption\" button. Once you encrypt your storage, you will be required to enter a numeric PIN or password to read encrypted data on SD card when PIN or password is changed without mounted SD card.
Only the data created or updated after enabling encryption on the storage you have selected will be encrypted. Any data created or updated prior to enabling encryption will remain unencrypted. Once data is encrypted, you will not be able to use it in other devices. (Any data that is created or updated after disabling encryption will not be encrypted but the data that has been previously encrypted will remain encrypted.)
If you perform a factory reset, you are not able to read the encrypted data stored in the internal storage or the SD card even if you do not check 'Erase SD card'. If you want to keep your data, backup the data before you perform a factory reset. If you interrupt the process, you will lose some or all of your data."

Your phone can share its approximate location with apps, which is useful for things like maps, shopping and weather. Apps that use your location should inform you. Be cautious and read their policies carefully to understand how they collect, use and share your location information.
